subject: Business
title: FOMO: Fear of Missing Out in Marketing
description: A short lesson to help you apply FOMO: Fear of Missing Out in Marketing.

hook.text: 'Only 2 left in stock!' You weren't going to buy it. Now you feel you have to.

buildup.text: FOMO combines scarcity and social proof: others are getting it and it's running out.

discovery.text: Booking.com mastered this: '5 people are looking at this room right now.' Anxiety drives booking.

twist.text: Research shows FOMO causes worse purchasing decisions. People buy things they don't need to avoid regret.

climax.text: Ethical brands use FOMO sparingly and honestly. Fake scarcity is a short-term win and a long-term reputation loss.

punchline.text: FOMO sells. But abusing it costs more than it earns.

quiz.question: What two psychological principles does FOMO combine?
